column1: Onya is a Quenya word with two possible meanings:
# a term of address simply meaning my son. Its only recorded use is between Meneldur and his son Tar-Aldarion
column2: but there is reason to believe that it was more widely used
column3: at least among noble Men. Its opposite was Atarinya
column5: and we know that this was used by the Exiles of NÃºmenor long after Meneldurs time
column6: so its reasonable to assume that the word onya survived in use at least into the Third Age
